episodeTitle: Sand Croc and Water Luffy! The Second Round of the Duel!
description: Luffy engages Crocodile in their second confrontation using water to counteract the Warlord's sand-based abilities. Meanwhile, the Straw Hats desperately search for a massive bomb set to destroy Alubarna, and Robin forces King Cobra to reveal the location of the Pluton Poneglyph in the Tomb of the Kings.

events.title: Water Luffy Technique Debut
events.description: Luffy drinks an entire barrel of water, bloating his stomach and dubbing himself 'Water Luffy' (Mizu Luffy). He uses this strategy to counter Crocodile's sand-based devil fruit abilities by squirting water from his mouth to dampen the Warlord.
events.significance: First instance of Luffy developing a creative counter-strategy against a Logia-type devil fruit user. Demonstrates his growing tactical thinking in combat situations.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy announces his new water-based fighting form after drinking a barrel of water

events.title: Mizu Mizu no Pistol Debut
events.description: Luffy uses a water-enhanced version of his signature Gomu Gomu no Pistol attack, combining his rubber abilities with the water he consumed to land effective hits on Crocodile.
events.significance: Shows evolution of Luffy's basic techniques when adapted to specific opponents. Marks one of the first times Luffy modifies his fighting style mid-battle.

events.title: Ground Secco Technique Debut
events.description: Crocodile places his hand on the ground and uses his dehydration ability to dry out a massive area around him, turning the palace garden into a barren desert wasteland. The technique causes the ground to crumble and collapse.
events.significance: Reveals the devastating scale of Crocodile's sand-based powers and his ability to affect large areas. Demonstrates why he's one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea.

quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile activates his area-of-effect dehydration technique

events.title: Ground Death Technique Debut
events.description: Crocodile uses an enhanced version of Ground Secco called Ground Death, which not only dries up the ground but transforms everything it touches—including people and buildings—into sand through sustained contact. This is one of his most devastating attacks.
events.significance: Establishes Crocodile as one of the most dangerous enemies Luffy has faced to this point. The technique's life-threatening nature raises the stakes of their battle significantly.

quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile unleashes his most powerful area dehydration attack

events.title: Luffy Loses Second Round Against Crocodile
events.description: Despite using water to counter Crocodile's sand abilities and landing several successful hits, Luffy ultimately loses the second round of their battle. The score stands at Crocodile 2, Luffy 0, highlighting the vast experience gap between the rookie pirate and the Warlord.
events.significance: Demonstrates that even with a clever strategy, Luffy still lacks the experience and strength to defeat a Warlord. Sets up the need for a third confrontation where Luffy must surpass his limits.

events.title: Robin Forces Cobra to Reveal Pluton Poneglyph Location
events.description: Nico Robin removes the stakes impaling King Cobra and forces him to lead her to the Tomb of the Kings, where the Poneglyph containing information about the ancient weapon Pluton is hidden. This reveals Robin's true agenda in working with Crocodile.
events.significance: Major revelation about Robin's knowledge of ancient weapons and her ability to read Poneglyphs. Introduces the concept of Pluton, one of the three ancient weapons, which becomes important to the overarching One Piece story.

events.title: Robin's Childhood Bounty Revealed
events.description: It is revealed that Nico Robin received a bounty of 79 million berries at the age of eight. The World Government claimed she sunk six Marine ships, though the true reason was her ability to read Poneglyphs after the destruction of Ohara.
events.significance: Provides crucial context for Robin's character and explains why she's been on the run her entire life. The exceptionally high bounty for a child highlights the World Government's fear of those who can read the true history.

events.title: Robin's Hatred of World Government Revealed
events.description: Robin explicitly states that she despises anyone affiliated with the World Government, revealing the deep trauma from her past and her motivations for seeking ancient weapons.
events.significance: Character development for Robin that foreshadows her eventual backstory reveal and explains her willingness to work with criminals like Crocodile.

events.title: Robin Uses Treinta Fleur
events.description: Nico Robin demonstrates her Hana Hana no Mi ability by using 'Treinta Fleur' (Thirty Flowers), sprouting thirty arms to restrain or manipulate her targets.
events.significance: Showcases the versatility and power of Robin's Devil Fruit abilities during the Arabasta Arc.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin activates her Devil Fruit ability

events.title: Robin Uses Strangle Technique
events.description: Robin uses her 'Strangle' technique, sprouting hands to choke or restrain opponents by wrapping around their necks or bodies.
events.significance: Demonstrates the combat applications of Robin's Devil Fruit abilities, showing she's not just an archaeologist but also a capable fighter.

events.title: Straw Hats Search for the Bomb
events.description: The Straw Hat crew frantically searches Alubarna for the massive time bomb planted by Crocodile, which threatens to kill a million soldiers and rebels. This is an anime-original expansion not present in the manga.
events.significance: Builds tension and urgency while showcasing the crew's determination to save innocent lives. Highlights the difference between the anime's pacing and the manga's more streamlined narrative.

events.title: Crocodile's Dehydration Hand Demonstrated
events.description: Crocodile demonstrates his right hand's ability to instantly desiccate anything it touches on a large scale, reducing living matter and the environment to dried husks or sand.
events.significance: Reveals one of Crocodile's most dangerous abilities and explains how he's been able to manipulate Arabasta's environment and intimidate opponents throughout the arc.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his new water-based fighting form

quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile activates his area dehydration technique

quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile unleashes his ultimate ground-based attack

themes.description: Luffy refuses to give up despite being outmatched by a Warlord of the Sea. Even after losing twice, his determination to save Arabasta and his friends drives him forward.
themes.symbolism: Water represents Luffy's adaptability and willingness to find creative solutions, while Crocodile's sand represents experience and established power.

themes.description: Robin's backstory and her desperate search for ancient knowledge reveal how trauma and persecution have shaped her life choices and moral compromises.
themes.symbolism: The Tomb of the Kings symbolizes buried history and the dangerous secrets that governments want to keep hidden.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes that Luffy's natural strength and creativity aren't enough to overcome Crocodile's years of experience as a Warlord, showing that growth requires more than just talent.
themes.symbolism: The score of 'Crocodile 2, Luffy 0' represents the gap between a seasoned veteran and an ambitious rookie.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows growth in tactical thinking by developing the Water Luffy strategy, but still lacks the experience to execute it successfully against a Warlord. His continued determination despite two losses demonstrates his unwavering spirit.
keyActions: Drinks an entire barrel of water to create 'Water Luffy'
Develops water-based variations of his techniques
Fights Crocodile more effectively than the first round
Loses the second round but refuses to give up

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile reveals more of his devastating devil fruit abilities, demonstrating why he holds the position of Warlord. His confidence borders on arrogance as he toys with Luffy.
keyActions: Uses Ground Secco to turn the palace garden into wasteland
Defeats Luffy for the second time

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's backstory is partially revealed, explaining her childhood bounty and hatred of the World Government. Her actions show a complex character driven by trauma and a desperate search for truth.
keyActions: Forces King Cobra to reveal the Poneglyph location
Uses Treinta Fleur and Strangle techniques
Leads Cobra to the Tomb of the Kings
Reveals her past persecution by the World Government

characterSpotlights.role: Captured king trying to protect his kingdom's secrets
characterSpotlights.development: Cobra shows dignity and responsibility even while being coerced, understanding the weight of protecting the Poneglyph while also recognizing the danger of its knowledge.
keyActions: Is forced by Robin to reveal the Poneglyph location
Travels to the Tomb of the Kings under duress

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime adds extended scenes of the Straw Hat crew searching for the bomb throughout Alubarna, which was not present in the original manga chapters 200-201.
The Water Luffy sequence is expanded in the anime with more comedic moments and reaction shots compared to the manga's more concise presentation.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts chapters 200-201 of the manga, which were part of the climactic battle sequence of the Arabasta Arc.
The episode achieved a TV rating of 12.9% and ranked #3 in its timeslot when it originally aired in Japan.
The opening song 'Hikari e' by The Babystars was their first and only single as a band.
This is the second of three battles between Luffy and Crocodile during the Arabasta Arc, marking the first time in the series that Luffy required three separate fights to defeat a single opponent.
The IMDb rating for this episode is 8.8/10, reflecting strong fan appreciation for this pivotal battle episode.
Nico Robin's 79 million berry bounty at age 8 is one of the highest known bounties for a child in the One Piece world, even exceeding Big Mom's childhood bounty of 50 million.
